lexUnit.name: oath.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a solemn promise, often invoking a divine witness, as to the truth of something or as a commitment to future action

sentence.text: Gotrek swore an oath that he would have his money or its weregeld price in Elf blood or he would shave his head .
Members of the estates then took a public oath that no trace of these hated documents should be preserved .
` I take the oath that this is none of my doing , " he said , blowing upon his charred finger-ends .

The Temperance movement , requiring an oath to moderate drinking or to abstain from certain drinks , seems to have begun in America : the first Temperance society was established in Puritan Connecticut in 1789 .

The owners of the woods were bound to present their woodwards to the Justice of the Forest on their appointment , and at every subsequent Forest Eyre , to take an oath to perform their duties faithfully .
Many Saxons were baptised and swore oaths to remain loyal , on threat of forfeiture of their lands and freedom .
Then he rose and swore a solemn oath to keep faith , to be true to his lord .
Henry III then gave the new matrix to Master Nicholas de Ely who took the oath to keep it faithfully .
Each of you has taken an oath to return a true verdict according to the evidence , but , of course , you have a duty not only as individuals , but collectively .
All pleaded guilty to this crime and took oath to perform whatever penance the Bishop should impose .
` Stephen swore a sacred oath to recognise Matilda as Queen .

Sometimes , as with the French annexation of Lille and Tournai , the king took an oath to respect the rights of the newly acquired cities even before their magistracies took one of allegiance to him .

Esau , in agreeing to the plan , is breaking his oath ( 25:33 ) .
` What has he done with his Hippocratic oath ? " asked Lydia severely .
Now , Lady Isabella , on your oath to the new king , have you ever visited the apothecary called Simon Foreman ? "

` On your oath to Christ , " Athelstan whispered , ` tell me the truth . "

Edward sent certain earls , barons and other councillors to put before convocation the charges against the Despensers and to enjoin the clergy on their fealty to advise him whether the banishment did violate his coronation oath .
Mr Major forced his pathetic Cabinet to swear a loyalty oath to him .
Ministerial jumpiness was further underlined last night when the junior energy minister , Mr Peter Morrison , demanded a public loyalty oath from all minsters .

I do n't feel comfortable about the prospect of us standing up and swearing oaths which neither of us intends to keep , " she told him .
